intro: Galactia densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial legume that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, often found in desert and semi-desert environments. The plant features compound leaves with small, ovate leaflets and produces clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Galactia densiflora plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in arid regions.
